item.title: Roblox: Legends of Speed Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Legends of Speed Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Legends of Speed
  • How to Get More Legends of Speed Codes
  • Legends of Speed Tips and Tricks
  • The Best Roblox Games Like Legends of Speed
  • About the Legends of Speed Developers

In this article, Roblox fans will find a list of codes for Legends of Speed , as well as other valuable information about the game. Redeeming Legends of Speed codes can significantly increase Roblox players' speed, as well as provide a few extra gems. With this in mind, it's a good idea to redeem all of them to get as many additional freebies as possible.

Updated December 22, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: This guide has been updated to provide you with the latest codes to redeem. It's an easy way to get freebies and save time.

All Legends of Speed Codes

Legends of Speed is not new, but the developers are updating it, and adding codes to improve the player's experience. Active codes that can help players in the game are listed below.

Codes Checked on December 22, 2024.

All Active Legends of Speed Codes

  • speedchampion000 - Use for 5,000 Gems.
  • racer300 - Use for 300 Steps.
  • SPRINT250 - Use this code for 250 Steps.
  • hyper250 - Use this code for 250 Steps.
  • legends500 - Use this code for 500 Gems.
  • sparkles300 - Use this code for 300 Gems.
  • Launch200 - Use this code for 200 Gems.

All Expired Legends of Speed Codes

There are no expired codes in the game, but active codes may soon become inactive, so players should hurry up and use them.

How to Redeem Codes in Legends of Speed

Just like in most other Roblox games, redeeming codes in Roblox : Legends of Speed is a very simple task that any user can handle. Everything that needs to be done to redeem codes is described in the short text instructions below:

  • Open Roblox and launch Legends of Speed .
  • Find the blue “Codes” button on the main screen of the game.
  • Click on this button.
  • Enter the offered code in the field that says "Type Code Here."

How to Get More Legends of Speed Codes

To obtain additional codes for the Legends of Speed game, players may check the page of the game developer on Twitter. Additionally, players may frequently monitor this article, which is periodically updated with new codes. It is recommended that players use the active codes as soon as possible before they expire.

Legends of Speed Tips and Tricks

After redeeming the above-mentioned codes, players should try to earn Gems for achieving a certain speed, since this will also give them a good starting point. It is worth finding a slot machine with pets and buying some there, which will give players a little boost as well. After that, all they have to do is walk around and collect spheres, as well as jump through the rings. When players are confident enough in their abilities, they can participate in races.

The Best Roblox Games Like Legends of Speed

Although it has quite interesting gameplay, there are plenty of other great Roblox games like Legends of Speed . The ones listed below have similar mechanics, so they are sure to appeal to Legends of Speed fans who are starting to grow tired of the game:

  • Legend of Heroes Simulator
  • Dragon Race
  • Race Clicker
  • Car Dealership Tycoon
  • Cart Ride Simulator

About the Legends of Speed Developers

Legends of Speed was created by very productive developers, Scriptbloxian Studios. Besides this game, they have created many other interesting games that are also worthy of attention:

  • Ninja Legends
  • Ninja Legends 2
  • Drilling Simulator
  • Muscle Legends

item.title: Temple Of Shadows Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
Temple Of Shadows is a mobile game based on the Naruto anime. It has fairly simple gameplay, but it is very enjoyable and addictive. This is an auto-battler where all players have to do is upgrade their ninjas and unlock new ones. The game is very generous from the very beginning and fans will quickly get plenty of fighters, the first of which will be Naruto. Nevertheless, it is possible to accelerate progress by entering several Temple Of Shadows codes. Using them, users will receive a lot of currency to upgrade their ninjas, as well as tickets to unlock new ones.

Updated December 22, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: Use these codes to unlock unique rewards in the game. They are easy to use, but only available for a limited time. Stay tuned for more updates.

All Temple Of Shadows Codes

Below, players will find all the active codes for Temple Of Shadows . By redeeming these codes, they can get both various game currencies and tickets that will allow them to get the best ninjas.

Codes Checked on December 22, 2024.

Active Temple Of Shadows Codes

  • itachi222 - Enter this code to get 100 Basic Summon Tickets. (NEW)
  • SASUKE777 - Enter this code to get 5 Premium Summon Tickets and 200 Gold.
  • Naruto111 - Enter this code to get 100 Raffle Tickets and 100 Basic Summon Tickets.
  • HOKAGE123 - Enter this code to get 100 Tier-up Orbs, 10 Missions Square Refresh Tickets, and 100 Basic Summon Tickets.
  • SUSANO123 - Enter this code to get 10 Missions Square Refresh Tickets and 200 Gold.
  • DISCORD123 - Enter this code to get 100 Tier-up Orbs, 300 Gold, and 1 Premium Summon Ticket.
  • KAGE999 - Enter this code to get 100 Tier-up Orbs, 10 Missions Square Refresh Tickets, and 100 Basic Summon Tickets.
  • KURAMA99 - Enter this code to get 100 Basic Summon Tickets.
  • CHAKRA77 - Enter this code to get 100 Raffle Tickets and 100 Basic Summon Tickets.
  • CHIDORI77 - Enter this code to get 100 Raffle Tickets and 100 Basic Summon Tickets.
  • KONOHA333 - Enter this code to get 20 Missions Square Refresh Tickets, 200 Gold, and 10,000 Silver.
  • MITSUKI789 - Enter this code to get 100 Golds and 10 Missions Square Refresh Tickets.
  • MOMOSHIKI - Enter this code to get 100 Gold and 2 Premium Summon Tickets.

All Expired Temple Of Shadows Codes

  • Mazakuata
  • HALLOWEEN24
  • octopus10
  • ishiki3039
  • sasuke0801
  • SHINOBI3RD1
  • SHINOBI3RD2
  • SHINOBI3RD3
  • Kurenai2403
  • Shizune0202
  • Karin1212
  • Susanoo2311
  • Haku2310
  • Tsunade0840

How to Redeem Codes in Temple Of Shadows

In Temple Of Shadows , users can redeem codes in the same way as in other similar mobile games. However, if players are unfamiliar with such games, they can use the instructions below:

  • Launch Temple Of Shadows .
  • In the upper-left corner, there is an avatar icon. Click on it.
  • An interface with 7 black buttons will open. Press the Redeem button with a gift drawn on it.
  • A field will open where players have to enter or paste the code.
  • Press Redeem.

Temple Of Shadows is now available on Android.

item.title: Awesome Marvel Rivals Image Concept Shows How Cool a Crossover With Insomniac's Spider-Man Could Be
item.description:
Summary

  • A Marvel Rivals fan recently designed some concept art envisioning an Insomniac Spider-Man crossover.
  • The crossover concept involves an interchange of the unique Spider-Man outfits in Marvel Rivals and Insomniac's Spider-Man 2.
  • The collaboration seems viable given Insomniac's post-launch suit additions to Spider-Man 2 and Marvel Rivals' live-service trappings.

A Marvel Rivals fan recently came up with a cool concept for an Insomniac Spider-Man crossover. Although Marvel Rivals features numerous Spider-Man skins, many players feel that a potential collaboration with Insomniac's popular Spider-Man 2 should be strongly considered for the live-service hero shooter.

Marvel Rivals is a hero shooter in the literal sense, as it features a 33-strong roster of heroes, villains, and everything in between from the expansive Marvel universe. Couple this with the distinctive art style and engaging gameplay, and it's no surprise that Marvel Rivals has racked up tens of millions of players in the few weeks it's been on the market. As with many other popular live-service games, though, Marvel Rivals fans are constantly conceptualizing new characters and crossovers, and one such pitch may have stumbled on a great idea.

Reddit user NathanRider recently proposed an exciting crossover between Marvel Rivals and Insomniac's Spider-Man 2 with two pieces of concept art. The first one envisions Peter Parker's iconic Advanced Suit from Spider-Man 2 as an alternate skin for Spider-Man in Marvel Rivals . Although the base image comes from Spider-Man 2 's box art, the suit is somewhat edited to resemble Marvel Rivals ' vivid art style for a more convincing concept, and it interestingly includes Venom's symbiote tendrils on the arm as well. Venom is also in Marvel Rivals , presenting an opportunity for unique interactions when the Insomniac Spider-Man suit is equipped.

Marvel Rivals and Insomniac's Spider-Man 2 Crossover Could Turn Out Fruitful for Both Games

NathanRider's second concept art goes in the opposite direction by bringing Marvel Rivals ' Spider-Man skin into Insomniac's Spider-Man 2 as an alternate suit for Peter Parker. Unlike the previous one, though, this Spider-Man suit retains the Marvel Rivals art style, which isn't too surprising since Insomniac rarely changes art styles for certain unique Spider-Man outfits when adding them to its games. A good example of this are the Spider-Verse suits for Miles Morales' Spider-Man, which include the same art style and animation as the movies.

The beauty of this crossover is that it seems quite viable given the context of both games. Insomniac adds new suits to Spider-Man 2 as post-launch support, and Marvel Rivals is a live-service title, so it may eventually indulge in crossovers with other games to increase player interest. Therefore, a collaboration between Marvel Rivals and Spider-Man 2 is a prospect that sounds far from a pipe dream. Should Marvel Rivals add more Spider-People in the future, Miles Morales' Spider-Man 2 suits could be folded into this crossover as well.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds Has One Major Advantage Over Elden Ring Nightreign
item.description:
Multiplayer action-RPG enthusiasts have a lot to look forward to in 2025, especially thanks to one early release and one recent announcement. Capcom’s Monster Hunter Wilds will be out by the end of February, and promises to let bands of hunters roam around larger, more interconnected maps than the Monster Hunter series has ever used before. Also with a beta in February is Elden Ring Nightreign , a co-op roguelike spin-off of FromSoftware’s wildly successful Elden Ring. Both Monster Hunter Wilds and Elden Ring Nightreign are changing things up for their respective franchises, and both promise to be worth the wait.

There are a lot of big features that could get someone excited about Monster Hunter Wilds , but for veterans, it doesn't need to be any more than the next evolution of Monster Hunter . Comparatively, some Elden Ring fans are still warming up to the run-based Nightreign , which is so openly strange that it's brought in Dark Souls bosses for extra flavor. It's even more different from its Soulslike predecessors than MH Wilds is from MH World and Rise , which is saying something. Uncertain hope trails behind both titles, but unfortunately, it already looks like Wilds ' has Nightreign soundly beaten in one area.

MH Wilds Has More Flexible Multiplayer Than Elden Ring Nightreign

Again, both Monster Hunter Wilds and Elden Ring Nightreign have a heavy emphasis on their multiplayer, but Wilds is putting in the work to ensure it stands out. Crossplay across Wilds ' simultaneous console and PC launches is just the first of its refinements compared to World and Rise , but it's definitely a big one. 100-player lobbies were also added, even if only 16 hunters can be seen at once, and players can freely join any hunts in progress that have room. Combined with more allowances for players to progress through their story and quest completion together, Monster Hunter Wilds sounds like the best multiplayer MH experience yet.

The same should be true for Elden Ring Nightreign , but evidence is mounting that it doesn't accommodate multiplayer any more than past FromSoftware games. Queuing up for runs alongside random players or friends via the typical code system is supported, but that's where the problems start. If those codes haven't given it away, Nightreign 's multiplayer is much more archaic than equivalents in other modern run-based games. How well the netcode works remains to be seen, but crossplay has been explicitly de-confirmed. Players can only play solo or in a group of three with no drop-in and an unknown disconnect policy, making Elden Ring Nightreign a remarkably inflexible experience.

Players Have More Freedom In Monster Hunter Wilds Than Nightreign

Nightreign deserves some credit, as it seemingly allows players to explore its condensed world without the boundaries and post-boss disconnects of regular Elden Ring , but it's hard to cover up how many options this spin-off has stripped away. Meanwhile, Monster Hunter Wilds is fine with one to four players doing whatever they want in its open world. Convenience has been the goal of post- World Monster Hunter , and Wilds is making sure that players will have minimal obstacles while hunting down monsters. Offline play is even bolstered with NPC helpers responding to SOS Flares, doubly ensuring that single-player is as viable as anything else.

Nightreign Has Options, But They're The Bare Minimum

If nothing else, Elden Ring Nightreign does support offline solo play, though how its scaling works compared to normal trios is still unknown. FromSoftware's usual NPC summons might be out this time, but one of Nightreign 's eight playable characters can apparently get help from their unique Spirit Ashes. Elden Ring Nightreign is far from a doomed endeavor as both a functional Souls roguelike and a multiplayer title, but it's a shame to see Monster Hunter Wilds already outdoing it as the latter in every way possible.

item.title: 8 Sandbox Games That Defined The Genre
item.description:
Summary

  • Sandbox games provide unparalleled freedom and creativity in vast open-world environments.
  • Titles like Ultima Online, Star Wars Galaxies, and GTA 5 have redefined the genre.
  • Games like No Man's Sky, Elite Dangerous, and Minecraft offer unique experiences and total freedom.

Sandbox games offer players unparalleled freedom to explore, create, and shape their virtual worlds without the confines of a linear structure. These games often provide vast, open-world environments, a range of activities to enjoy, and open-ended gameplay, fostering creativity and immersion.

Over the years, numerous titles have redefined the genre, setting new standards for player interaction and freedom, as well as the size and quality of the world the player inhabits. Whether exploring space, roleplaying in a virtual urban environment, or simply building impressive creations, these games have pushed the envelope and helped to define the genre in some way or another.

8 Ultima Online

The First Sandbox MMORPG

Ultima Online was launched in 1997, meaning that it is one of the longest-running MMORPGs of all time, some 27 years at the time of writing. But it isn’t just the longevity that makes the game special, or the reason why it made this list. It was also the first sandbox MMORPG.

The gameplay in UO takes place on a huge open-world map, and players are free to take any actions they choose. The game uses a classless system, with players free to spend their 700 skill points on any of the game's skill trees, mixing and matching them to create a unique build. Furthermore, the UO game economy relies on player crafters and player resource gatherers as well.

7 Star Wars Galaxies

Controversial Sandbox MMORPG

Star Wars Galaxies is now often seen as being ahead of its time. Unfortunately, during its short life, this was actually a detriment rather than a bonus. With its unique resource spawning system and detailed research and crafting gameplay, the economy relied on players to cooperate to farm resources and build items and equipment. And this is the reason it is included on this list. Not just a player-run economy, but resource and supply chains requiring deep player interaction.

Players were free to take skills from any of the game's skill trees, as long as they unlocked the prerequisites, to create specialized builds. Furthermore, it was quite possible for a player to be both a crafter and a fighter in this game. Unfortunately, some poor decisions led the game away from its sandbox roots, which ultimately contributed to its downfall.

6 No Man’s Sky

Sandbox Space Exploration

No Man’s Sky is widely renowned as one of the best space exploration and survival titles to date. Players can tackle the game solo, or play together in a huge open universe with over 4 trillion star systems.

What makes No Man’s Sky worthy of a place on this list, is that aside from a few key systems that are part of a game plat of one of the community expeditions, every star system, planet, biome, create and planet is entirely procedurally generated. Sure, the game had something of a rocky launch, but it has gone from strength to strength since then.

5 Elite Dangerous

Massive Accurate Galaxy

Elite Dangerous makes this list for a very particular reason. It features an astronomically correct recreation of the Milky Way galaxy. To put this into context, this means that the game has over 400 billion star systems for players to explore in this sandbox space game.

As with some of the other games on this list, its uniqueness has often seen the game struggle to become widely accepted, as it doesn’t fit into any single genre, and can be very challenging for new players. But as open-world sandbox games go, there is none bigger.

4 Grand Theft Auto 5

Freedom Of Choice For Players

This list wouldn't be complete without featuring GTA 5 . At the time of writing, it was the second most successful game ever, behind Minecraft. The dynamic open-world map and sandbox-style gameplay in GTA 5 allow the player to exercise full agency, which is why it is on this list.

In recent years, GTA 5 has switched over to a live-service model, and the multiplayer version, GTA Online , has become wildly popular. Players are free to live their virtual lives in any way they see fit in this urban sandbox game. Engaging roleplay possibilities abound in this game, and this is another reason why it made this list.

3 EVE Online

Emergent Player-Driven Politics

EVE Online has been operating for more than two decades, and is still widely popular in 2024. The fan base is incredibly loyal, with some players living an entire alternative life within the game. It makes this list due to the way that the political landscape is entirely shaped by player-run corporations and alliances.

However, the player-driven economy would also be a valid reason for it to be added to this list as well. Since launch, EVE Online has repeatedly set world records for the number of players in a single battle, and the largest value of game assets destroyed in a battle.

2 Minecraft

Total Freedom To Build

We have already had the second most successful game ever on this list, GTA 5 . Now it is time to present the most successful, Minecraft . It makes this list due to the fact it offers players total freedom to build whatever they wish, with creativity only limited by the player’s imagination.

Additionally, Minecraft is a game that is accessible to players of all ages, without the need to purchase expensive gaming hardware. This is undoubtedly one of the main causes of the game’s massive success.

1 Red Dead Redemption 2

Sandbox Meets Movie

The final game on this list, Red Dead Redemption 2 , has been included for the seamless way it incorporates sandbox gameplay and freedom of choice, into a game that has some of the best scripted gameplay around.

Furthermore, the way the player interacts with the open world is nothing short of incredible in the way creators and NPCs react to the player's actions. Few games offer the same level of immersion as Red Dead Redemption 2, whilst still enabling the player to have complete freedom of action.
